name: International Fund for Houbara Conservation
legal: Public Authority Established by Law 7 of 2014
goal: Advance scientific research and international collaboration for natural sustainability of Houbara populations and supporting habitats while stepping up contributions to biodiversity of natural environment and ecological sustainability of wildlife for the human well-being and economic prosperity.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Education, Environment
euInitiatives:
• Bird Directive
By supporting EU partners in the completion of the Bird Directive with a particular focus on bustard species

• Wildlife Trade Legislation (CITES)
By conducting researches and providing data on the status of bustard species which range extend beyond the European boarders
By supporting organisms in the EU conducting researches on the status of bustard species


• Biodiversity Strategy
o Target 1: Protection of Species and Habitats
By supporting organisms or states initiatives involved in the protection of bustard species and their habitats

o Target 2: Maintain and Restore Ecosystems
By supporting organisms or states initiatives involved in the restoration of bustard species

• Knowledge and data
IFHC is involved in the promotion and sharing of biodiversity data with the development of an open source software dedicated to biodiversity inventories
